title: Citi Handlowy Features in the RESPECT Index for the Seventh Year
summary: Warsaw - The Warsaw Stock Exchange announced the results of the seventh edition of the prestigious RESPECT Index. Citi Handlowy has been included in the Index for the 7th year. The listing was announced at a gala ceremony in the Warsaw Stock Exchange building on December 17, 2013.
tag-1: Citi Handlowy Features in the RESPECT Index for the Seventh Year
tag-2: Warsaw – The Warsaw Stock Exchange announced the results of the seventh edition of the prestigious RESPECT Index. Citi Handlowy has been included in the Index for the 7th year. The listing was announced at a gala ceremony in the Warsaw Stock Exchange building on December 17, 2013.
tag-3: "We have been listed in the Index regularly since it began in 2009, confirming our positions as one of the most socially responsible companies on the Warsaw Stock Exchange, which undoubtedly is not without significance for investors. It is recognition of our high standards in the corporate social responsibility space, which is also an important element of the Citi's strategy," says Katarzyna Otko-Dabrowska, Director of Investor Relations at Citi Handlowy.
tag-4: The RESPECT Index, launched by Warsaw Stock Exchange, is the first social responsibility index in Central and Eastern Europe. The companies included in the RESPECT portfolio maintain the highest corporate governance, information disclosure and investor relations standards. Their activities in the area of environmental protection, corporate social responsibility (CSR) and employee relations, which are an integral part of the Bank's business strategy, also have an impact on being listed in the RESPECT Index.
tag-5: "Citi Handlowy continues to be a CSR leader in the market. It currently runs Poland's largest employee volunteer program, which has been operating since 2005 and boasts significant achievements in this field. It is thanks to these types of activities that we owe our position in the RESPECT Index, which is now one of the most coveted distinctions for listed companies," said Krzysztof Kaczmar, President of the Kronenberg Foundation at Citi Handlowy, when receiving the RESPECT certificate.
tag-6: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
tag-7: Additional information may be found at www.citigroup.com | Twitter: @Citi | YouTube: www.youtube.com/citi | Blog: http://blog.citigroup.com | Facebook: www.facebook.com/citi | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/citi
tag-8: Bank Handlowy w Warszawie S.A. is one of the largest financial institutions in Poland, offering a wide range of modern corporate, investment and retail banking products and services under the Citi Handlowy brand. Bank Handlowy serves 20,000 corporate clients and 851,534 individual clients through modern distribution channels and a network of 87 branches. The Bank's capital group includes such entities as the Brokerage House of Bank Handlowy and Handlowy Leasing. Being part of Citigroup, the world's largest financial institution, Bank Handlowy can guarantee its clients access to financial services in over 100 countries across the world. For further information, please visit the Bank Handlowy website www.citihandlowy.pl
